s0597: Confucius was buried north of Lu city on the Si River, disciples all mourned for three years.
s0598: After three years the mourning in heart was complete, they bid farewell and left, then wept, each exhausting their grief;
s0600: Only Zi Gong built a hut on the tomb, for six years in all, then left.
s0601: Disciples and Lu people who moved to live by the tomb numbered over one hundred households, thus named Kong Village.
s0602: Lu generation after generation transmitted to offer sacrifice to Confucius's tomb at the seasons, while Confucian scholars also lectured on ritual, rural feasts, and great archery at Confucius's tomb.
s0603: Confucius's tomb was one qing in size.
s0604: Therefore in the hall where he resided among disciples, later generations accordingly made a temple to store Confucius's clothes, hat, zither, chariot, books, continuing to the Han for over two hundred years without cease.
